snippet: Peace has eased safety concerns in Helmand Province, but there is little faith in the Afghan government’s ability to maintain the security gains won by American and British troops.
abstract: Peace has eased safety concerns about Taliban in Afghanistan's Helmand Province, but there is little faith in Afghan government’s ability to maintain the security gains won by American and British troops; many citizens and provincial officials worry much of province will drift back under Taliban control after NATO combat mission ends in 2014.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Peace has eased safety concerns in Helmand Province, but there is little faith in the Afghan government’s ability to maintain the security gains won by American and British troops.

headline.seo: In Old Taliban Strongholds, Qualms About What Lies Ahead
headline.main: In Old Taliban Strongholds, Qualms About What Lies Ahead
headline.print_headline: In Old Taliban Strongholds, Qualms on What Lies Ahead
